      51             : // Note, the ownership of mozilla::dom::Selection depends on which way the
      52             : // object is created. When nsFrameSelection has created Selection,
      53             : // addreffing/releasing the Selection object is aggregated to nsFrameSelection.
      54             : // Otherwise normal addref/release is used.  This ensures that nsFrameSelection
      55             : // is never deleted before its Selections.

     368             :   /**
     369             :    * GetCommonEditingHostForAllRanges() returns common editing host of all
     370             :    * ranges if there is. If at least one of the ranges is in non-editable
     371             :    * element, returns nullptr.  See following examples for the detail:
     372             :    *
     373             :    *  <div id="a" contenteditable>
     374             :    *    an[cestor
     375             :    *    <div id="b" contenteditable="false">
     376             :    *      non-editable
     377             :    *      <div id="c" contenteditable>
     378             :    *        desc]endant
     379             :    *  in this case, this returns div#a because div#c is also in div#a.
     380             :    *
     381             :    *  <div id="a" contenteditable>
     382             :    *    an[ce]stor
     383             :    *    <div id="b" contenteditable="false">
     384             :    *      non-editable
     385             :    *      <div id="c" contenteditable>
     386             :    *        de[sc]endant
     387             :    *  in this case, this returns div#a because second range is also in div#a
     388             :    *  and common ancestor of the range (i.e., div#c) is editable.
     389             :    *
     390             :    *  <div id="a" contenteditable>
     391             :    *    an[ce]stor
     392             :    *    <div id="b" contenteditable="false">
     393             :    *      [non]-editable
     394             :    *      <div id="c" contenteditable>
     395             :    *        de[sc]endant
     396             :    *  in this case, this returns nullptr because the second range is in
     397             :    *  non-editable area.
     398             :    */
     399             :   Element* GetCommonEditingHostForAllRanges();
     400             : 
     401             :   // These are the ranges inside this selection. They are kept sorted in order
     402             :   // of DOM start position.
     403             :   //
     404             :   // This data structure is sorted by the range beginnings. As the ranges are
     405             :   // disjoint, it is also implicitly sorted by the range endings. This allows
     406             :   // us to perform binary searches when searching for existence of a range,
     407             :   // giving us O(log n) search time.
     408             :   //
     409             :   // Inserting a new range requires finding the overlapping interval, requiring
     410             :   // two binary searches plus up to an additional 6 DOM comparisons. If this
     411             :   // proves to be a performance concern, then an interval tree may be a
     412             :   // possible solution, allowing the calculation of the overlap interval in
     413             :   // O(log n) time, though this would require rebalancing and other overhead.
     414             :   nsTArray<RangeData> mRanges;
     415             : 
     416             :   RefPtr<nsRange> mAnchorFocusRange;
     417             :   RefPtr<nsFrameSelection> mFrameSelection;
     418             :   RefPtr<nsAutoScrollTimer> mAutoScrollTimer;
     419             :   nsCOMArray<nsISelectionListener> mSelectionListeners;
     420             :   nsRevocableEventPtr<ScrollSelectionIntoViewEvent> mScrollEvent;
     421             :   CachedOffsetForFrame *mCachedOffsetForFrame;
     422             :   nsDirection mDirection;
     423             :   SelectionType mSelectionType;
     424             :   /**
     425             :    * True if the current selection operation was initiated by user action.
     426             :    * It determines whether we exclude -moz-user-select:none nodes or not,
     427             :    * as well as whether selectstart events will be fired.
     428             :    */
     429             :   bool mUserInitiated;
     430             : 
     431             :   /**
     432             :    * When the selection change is caused by a call of Selection API,
     433             :    * mCalledByJS is true.  Otherwise, false.
     434             :    */
     435             :   bool mCalledByJS;
     436             : 
     437             :   // Non-zero if we don't want any changes we make to the selection to be
     438             :   // visible to content. If non-zero, content won't be notified about changes.
     439             :   uint32_t mSelectionChangeBlockerCount;
     440             : };
